commit.message:
Reimplement `RequestContext.toString()`

- Use `TemporaryThreadLocals` to reduce `StringBuilder` reallocation.
- Add `RequestId`s
- Move the slow path to a separate method so that fast path can be
  inlined.
- Add `TextFormatter.socketAddress()` and `inetAddress()`
- Miscellaneous:
  - Fix method ordering.
  - Fix indentation
  - Fix for a potential `NPE` on Windows in
    `DefaultServiceRequestContext.{local,remote}Address()`

nodes.bodyText:
This is less clear again. I think we have a convention of not calling any methods during thread local building because it's not clear whether that method may reinitialize the buffer or not. toString is of course a common culprit but not necessarily the only one. Actually the javadoc rule of thumb doesn't seem strong enough, it's not really an issue of recursion and just about whether other methods may initialize a buffer so the general rule of thumb is to call no other methods unless they accept a StringBuilder as a parameter. armeria/core/src/main/java/com/linecorp/armeria/internal/common/util/TemporaryThreadLocals.java Line 47 in 9061e24 *

A rule of thumb is to use the thread-local variables provided by this class in a narrow scope
